title: Pep Guardiola needs a whole new defence if Man City are serious about Europe after Monaco humiliation
text:
Sport Opinion Pep Guardiola needs a whole new defence if Man City are serious about Europe after Monaco humiliation Willy Caballero, Gael Clichy and Bacary Sagna will soon be free agents and this abject performance showed just why Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Pep Guardiola speaks after crashing out of the Champions League Share this video Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe 
What a humiliating way for Pep Guardiola to mark his 100th game in European football. 
Guardiola joined the elite 100 Club that includes such iconic bosses as Sir Alex Ferguson, Arsene Wenger, Jose Mourinho and Louis van Gaal. 
But there was no cause for celebration from the Manchester City boss as he got his tactics hopelessly wrong and blemished his formidable Champions League record. 
Guardiola had never failed to make the semi-finals, reaching that stage on seven previous occasions, but last night that proud record disintegrated, along with City’s European campaign. City again failed on the European stage as they crashed out on away goals (Photo: Getty Images) Monaco continue to surprise all and sundry as they continue scoring their way to success (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Monaco 3-1 Manchester City (6-6 agg) PLAYER RATINGS as Aleksandar Kolarov and Gael Clichy fail to fire 
City went into the game on the back of six straight clean sheets away from home, a club record, but their collective disorganisation at the back ultimately saw them unravel here. 
But what do you expect when three of your back five are out of contract at the end of the season and likely to be on their way this summer? 
Willy Caballero, Gael Clichy and Bacary Sagna will soon be free agents and this abject performance showed just why none of them are likely to be offered a contract extension. 
Sagna was tormented by Monaco’s gifted teenage attacker Kylian Mbappe, Clichy was given the runaround by Bernardo Silva, while Caballero is only in goal because he is less of a liability than Claudio Bravo. 
Guardiola has a major defensive rebuild on his hands this summer, his problems there compounded by the continued absence of skipper Vincent Kompany, who has become little more than a cheerleader these days, travelling with the squad but never making the 18. Guardiola cut a frustrated figure on the touchline as he watched his players crash out (Photo: Getty Images) Read More Monaco 3-1 Manchester City (6-6 agg): Pep Guardiola's men OUT of Champions League - 5 things we learned 
If City are serious about becoming major players among Europe’s elite, they will need to recruit virtually an entire new defence this summer, with two full-backs, a centre-back and a goalkeeper of stature required. 
John Stones, bought from Everton for £47million, has suffered from playing alongside such mediocre defenders and must be the man around whom Guardioka builds his new rearguard. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
